intro: Malleastrum, commonly known as the common mallow, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The flowers are typically showy, with five petals and prominent stamens. Malleastrum species are often found in moist, temperate regions and can thrive in a variety of soil types. These plants are valued for their ornamental appeal and have been used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
